title: SKOP opposes govt plan of leasing out NCT to foreign firm
body: Leaders of Sramik Karmachari Oikya Parishad, a combine of 14 labour rights bodies, at a protest rally on Friday called on the interim government to refrain from leasing out the management of New Mooring container terminal of Chattogram port to a foreign company. They also demanded that the government refrain from leasing out container terminals of the countryâ€™s other ports to foreign operators. SKOP organised the rally in front of the National Press Club in the capital Dhaka, with labour leader Abdul Kader Hawlader in the chair. Jatiyabadi Sramik Dal president Anwar Hossain said that the government had already leased out the management of two container terminals of the country to foreign companies, which went against the national interests. The interim government was planning to lease out the New Mooring container terminal of the Chattogram port to a foreign company, he said. He called on the interim government to refrain from leasing out terminals of the ports to foreign companies. Labour leaders Chowdhury Ashiqul Alam, Razequzzaman Ratan, Saifuzzman Badsha, Naimul Ahsan Jewel and Ahsan Habib Bulbul, among others, spoke at the rally. The rally was followed by a torch procession that paraded different city roads. Moreover, the SKOP held countrywide protest programmes to press its demands, a press release said. SKOP will hold red-flag procession towards the Chattogram port at 11:00am on December 10.
